page.title: 14Bellister - Haltwhistle.
page.content: We went to{Bellister Castle.} We saw the very old part of the castle which is a ruin. The walls were made of round stones from the river and square stones that could have come from the Roman Wall. We measured the walls. They were 1 metre 56 centimetres thick. The castle was built about 700 years ago by Robert de Ros as a protection against the Scots who used to come over the border to steal cattle and to fight the English farmers. There is supposed to be a{secret {passage}to the church and the Red Lion (an old pele tower) in Haltwhistle. We saw an old stone that said {"JB1667"}when the castle was enlarged by John Blenkinsopp for his son.
